headline: Government Associate  | Program Specialist  |  Office Manager
summary: Highly motivated, results-oriented specialist with 8 yearsâ expertise in a focused-approach to developing and delivering organizational objectives. Talented team leader with notable success defining and driving process improvements and working with diverse cultures. Superior ability to collaborate with colleagues and stakeholders, deliver the best-in-class customer service, and exceed performance expectations. Outstanding written and oral communication skills and technological savvy, coupled with strong knowledge of the Federal Emergency Management Agency, United States Department of Homeland Security, and Internal Revenue Service policies and procedures. Extensive personnel management and administrative experience, including demonstrated proficiency in handling classified information, dynamic problem solving, and decision-making with a high level of integrity.

defaultPosition.description:
â¢	Support the DSA mission in an effort to build and sustain an expeditionary cadre to establish a timely presence in disaster impacted areas, while focusing on addressing the needs of disproportionately impacted populations and disaster survivors. 
â¢	Offer accessible, in-person case-specific information and referrals. 
â¢	Provide survivors with referrals to whole community partners as needed. 
â¢	Identify disability-inclusive public information needs so strategic messaging can be developed and disseminated.
â¢	Maintain case status updates, inquiries, and on-site survivor information. 
â¢	Provide basic information about application status and other eligible assistance. 
â¢	Collect and review new information or documents while updating case files.
â¢	Coordinate the on-site registration intake process. 
â¢	Register survivors for disaster assistance, provide guidance through registration, and provide an overview of FEMA disaster assistance. 
â¢	Conduct survivor need assessments and engage disaster survivors and local officials in identifying immediate unmet needs for a quick resolution via FEMA and/or our whole community partners.
â¢	Conduct community outreach and create partnerships with the local and state emergency managers, disability partners, private sector, voluntary agencies, faith-based and community-based organizations to foster a culture of strengthened alliances to support the delivery of inclusive, equitable services to survivors.
â¢	Assess, inform, and report critical and emerging disaster needs to the Operations Section and other Joint Field Office (JFO) leadership for decision-making purposes.

positions.description:
â¢	Research detainee history using multiple sources which include EAGLE, Central Index System (CIS), ENFORCE Removal Module (EARM) to establish identity/citizenship and manage detained dockets. 
â¢	Provide administrative support to managers, supervisors and staff members by assisting in daily management of officeâs activities.
â¢	Summarize and tabulate detainee information from various reports, utilizing a variety of databases and automated systems. 
â¢	Generate and verify detainee reports, encounters, charging documents, data quality and create/revise spreadsheets. 
â¢	Log detainee requests submitted to Detention Officers in preparation for audits. 
â¢	Search federal, state, and local law enforcement records and databases. 
â¢	Compile, evaluate, and report actionable intelligence information to senior level officers. 
â¢	Prepare travel presentations for detainees by uploading Judge Orders for removal along with passport photos and fingerprints in the Electronic Travel Document (eTD) system, used to communicate with a variety of Consulates to return aliens to their appropriate country.
â¢	Gather inventory of vacancies in detention facilities along with new transfers to submit on the evening report for the Assistant Field Office Director (AFOD). 
â¢	Submit requests for Judgment of Conviction (JOC) and Plea Transcripts to various superior courts preparing files for deportation of detainees.
â¢	Obtain and analyze the validity of foreign identity documents to obtain a travel document, and enforce the departure of aliens from the U.S. through the execution of final removal orders. 
â¢	Collect data and assist Deportation Officer in order to prepare and issue 205/294 forms (warrant of removal/deportation and warning to alien ordered removed documents).
positions.title: Enforcement Removal Assistant

positions.description:
â¢	Generated and analyzed reports and inputted hours charged to cases for multiple teams comprised of 20 agents. 
â¢	Entered tax deficiencies or penalties in ERCS for managerâs approval. 
â¢	Provided correct disposal code for the preparation of case processing. 
â¢	Completed Integrated Data Retrieval System (IDRS) requests and submitted via email using MultiPrint. 
â¢	Processed reports weekly using Issue Based Management Information System (IBMIS) to maintain correct hours charged to cases by agents in ERCS.
â¢	Assisted other group secretaries with technical questions regarding case closures, including but not limited to understanding the issues, identifying the problem, and recommending solutions. 
â¢	Contacted agents via email, Office Communicator, and telephone, providing their locations for the day in order to reconcile hours with SETR.
â¢	Reviewed and inputted time and attendance records for 7 employees on a biweekly basis using SETR. 
â¢	Investigated employee conduct cases in conjunction with the Employee Communication and Correspondence Office (ECCO), which included analyzing the allegations, interviewing all parties involved, summarizing the facts, and recommending possible disciplinary actions. 
â¢	Complied with the Personal Identification Information (PII) policy by immediately filing any forms that possess taxpayer information, while securing locked file cabinets.
positions.location: Self-Employment/Small Business Division, New York, NY
positions.title: Secretary

positions.description:
â¢	Assisted Program Manager in remote location with documenting and editing mid-year reviews and end of year assessments for 8 Managers throughout the eastern states (performed all duties while simultaneously working regular functions as Secretary).
â¢	Generated reports requested on the Examination Return Control System (ERCS) on a biweekly basis for 9 groups. 
â¢	Composed and managed territories gain/loss report monthly. 
â¢	Prepared memoranda of appreciation and responses for final approval. 
â¢	Reviewed all managers 1204 responses, certifying to the Commissioner each quarter, ensuring no tax enforcement were violated in any manner. 
â¢	Inputted personnel action requests via Human Resources (HR Connect) for temporary promotions, detail assignments, power recruitments, and mid-year assessments. 
â¢	Secured travel arrangements for hotel, airfare, and prepared travel vouchers for approval. 
â¢	Maintained and scheduled Supervisorâs calendar with priority actions and appointments.
â¢	Compiled monthly briefings from 9 different groups for submission to the Chief. 
â¢	Discussed administrative updates during monthly territory meetings with the Territory and Group Managers via conference call. 
â¢	Submitted minutes to the Program Manager regarding monthly territory meetings.
â¢	Inputted and reconciled time and attendance records for 15 employees on a biweekly basis using Single Entry Time Reporting System (SETR).
positions.location: Self-Employment/Small Business Division â East Territory, New York, NY
positions.title: Acting Territory Secretary
